title: (x) Looking for the font "Deadwood" - Psy/Ops {Yves}
content:
Hello

Is”Deadwood” a font?

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20080310190820im_/http:/www.typophile.com/files/Deadwood_4397.jpg)

 [‹ (x) "Edge of the City" poster type (Saul Bass) - Trade Gothic {Lex}](http://web.archive.org/web/20080310190820/http:/www.typophile.com/node/20071 "Go to previous forum topic") [(x) I.D. magazine body type - Coranto {Benjamin Shaykin} ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080310190820/http:/www.typophile.com/node/20062 "Go to next forum topic")
author: misalion

comments.content:
Ha.

Something [here](http://web.archive.org/web/20080310190820/http:/www.typophile.com/node/12892) should get you close.
The big question now is: were the designers of the television series too clever for their own good and choose the font for the series logo and/or credits? :^P
But is does not look like this “deadwood”....?
Deadwood is indeed a typeface but not that particular one. Deadwood is distributed by Psy/Ops.

That blue colour to indicate links really isn’t visible enough — clicking my original reply “Yup” took you to the Psy/Ops page with the [Deadwood](http://web.archive.org/web/20080310190820/http:/www.psyops.com/html/spec_deadwood.html) family by [Philip Krayna](http://web.archive.org/web/20080310190820/http:/www.typophile.com/wiki/Philip%252BKrayna) and [Rodrigo Xavier Cavazos](http://web.archive.org/web/20080310190820/http:/www.typophile.com/wiki/Rodrigo%252BXavier%252BCavazos). But I reckon nobody saw the link. :^/

I guess _I_ was the one being too clever for my own good.
